item.title: There once was a cat named Posey
item.description: There once was a cat named Posey Her gaze is often quite dozy A red bug comes to race She crouches and gives chase Her pounce turns the red bug rosy!

item.title: Environs
item.description: Some of the places that I like and recommend in New York, presented in no particular order (WIP). browse McNally Jackson Independent Booksellers. In Nolita (Manhattan), closest to Bowery , Broadway-Lafayette St , or Spring St . Zabar’s. On the Upper West Side (Manhattan), closest to 79 St or 81 St - Museum of Natural History . eat La Newyorkina. Mexican ice cream. In Greenwich Village (Manhattan), closest to West 4 St - Washington Sq .

item.title: Projects
item.description: Publications Clinical Computer Security for Victims of Intimate Partner Violence. Sam Havron*, Diana Freed*, Rahul Chatterjee, Damon McCoy, Nicola Dell, and Thomas Ristenpart. USENIX Security 2019 (to appear). The Spyware Used in Intimate Partner Violence. Rahul Chatterjee, Periwinkle Doerfler, Hadas Orgad, Sam Havron, Jackeline Palmer, Diana Freed, Karen Levy, Nicola Dell, Damon McCoy, and Thomas Ristenpart. IEEE S&P (Oakland) 2018. [Paper PDF]. Media coverage: The New York Times, Vox, Freedom to Tinker (Princeton CITP).

item.title: About
item.description: Here is a brief biography suitable for use in brochures, advertisements, media, etc. The image on this page should be of sufficient resolution for small printing. My CV/resume is available here, current as of latest commit. Sam Havron is a PhD student in computer science at Cornell University; he is in residence at Cornell Tech on Roosevelt Island in New York City. He is part of a research team studying computer security and privacy issues in the context of intimate partner violence (IPV).

item.title: Home
item.description: -- I’m a student at Cornell Tech. I’m part of a research team studying computer security and privacy issues in the context of intimate partner violence.
